quiz.text: Poverty Gap reflects which of the following ?
options: Gap in infrastructural facilities between developed and developing nations
The difference between poverty line and actual income level of all those living below that line
Gap between developed nations and developing nations
Gap between the rich people and poor people
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is a method to measure relative poverty?
options: Gini coefficient
Lorenz curve
Poverty line
Both A and B
A, B and C

quiz.text: Which of the following committee is not associated with poverty estimation ?
options: Tendulkar committee
Lakdawala Committee
Alagh Committee
Rangarajan Committee
Shah Committee

quiz.text: The current weekly status of a person is calculated with a reference period of
options: 5 days
6 days
7 days
4 days
30 days

quiz.text: It refers to a condition where a person does not have the minimum amount of income needed to meet the minimum requirements for one or more basic living needs over an extended period of time. Which of the following best describes the statement?
options: Absolute Poverty
Relative Poverty
Generational Poverty
Situational Poverty
None of the above

quiz.text: Identification of the poor in India is done by which of the following?
options: Ministry of Rural Development
Ministry of Home Affairs
Ministry of Panchayati Raj
State Governments
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following agency commenced Socio Economic Caste Census in 2011?
options: Ministry of Home Affairs
Ministry of Panchayati Raj
Ministry of Rural Development
State Governments
Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

quiz.text: Match the author/committee and their poverty concept :
options: 1- A, 2- B, 3 - C, 4 - D
1- B, 2 - A, 3 - D, 4 - C
1- C, 2- A, 3 - B, 4 - D
1-D, 2 - C, 3 - A, 4 - B
1-C, 2 - D, 3 - A, 4 - B

quiz.text:
Sen Index is associated with the measurement of which of the following social problems? 
  1. Poverty 
  2. Public health
  3. Social disorganization
options: 1 and 3 Only
1, 2 and 3
Only 1
2 and 3 only
Only 3

quiz.text: One of the earliest estimations of poverty was done and mentioned in the book, ‘Poverty and the Un-British Rule in India’. Who of the following had written the book?
options: Bal Gangadhar Tilak
Dadabhai Naoroji
Motilal Nehru
Jawahar Lal Nehru
Mahatma Gandhi

quiz.text:
In 1962, the Planning Commission constituted a working group to estimate poverty nationally, and it formulated separate poverty lines for rural and urban areas – of Rs 20 and Rs 25 per capita per year respectively. ______________made the first systematic assessment of poverty in India in 1971, based on National Sample Survey (NSS) data from 1960-61. They argued that the poverty line must be derived from the expenditure that was adequate to provide 2250 calories per day in both rural and urban areas. This generated debate on minimum calorie consumption norms while estimating poverty and variations in these norms based on age and sex. 

Who of the following made the first systematic assessment of poverty in India in 1971?
options: Y K Alagh
DT Lakdawala
Suresh Tendulkar
C. Rangarajan
VM Dandekar and N Rath

quiz.text: For each country, Global Hunger Index (GHI) values are determined by which of the following indicators 1. Undernourishment 2. Child Wasting 3. Child Stunting 4. Child Morality Choose the correct answer using the codes given below
options: 1 and 4 only
1, 2 and 4 only
1, 2 and 3 only
3 and 4 only
1, 2, 3 and 4

quiz.text: Which of the following Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) is associated with poverty eradication?
options: SDG 4
SDG 2
SDG 3
SDG 6
SDG 1

quiz.text:
In 1993, an expert group constituted to review methodology for poverty estimation, chaired by DT Lakdawala, made the suggestion that state specific poverty lines should be constructed and these should be updated using _______________ index in urban areas.

Which of the following is suitable for filling the blank?
options: Consumer Price Index of Agricultural Labour (CPI-AL)
Consumer Price Index of Industrial Workers (CPI-IW)
Wholesale Price Index (WPI)
Consumer Price Index - Combined
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following Committee first recommended using Mixed Reference Period (MRP) based estimates, as opposed to Uniform Reference Period (URP) based estimates that were used in earlier methods for estimating poverty?
options: Lakdawala Committee
Tendulkar Commitee
Alagh Committee
Dandekar and Rath Committee
Rangarajan Committee

quiz.text: Which of the following is official poverty line for urban and rural areas?
options: 931, 651
1000, 816
1407, 972
1200, 883
700, 432

quiz.text: Poverty estimation based on calorie consumption was first recommended by which of the following committee?
options: National Planning Committee
Alagh Committee
Tendulkar Committee
Lakdawala Committee
Dandekar and Rath Committee

quiz.text: Consider the following statements: 1) Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act was enacted in 2007. 2) It promises to give a minimum of 100 days of unskilled manual labour to a rural household whose adult members volunteer for it. 3) Households are eligible for unemployment allowances if employment has not been provided within 15 days of demand. 4) Social audit by the Gram Sabha has to be conducted at least once in every year. Choose the incorrect option using the code given below:
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 4 only
2 and 4 only
1, 2 and 3 only

quiz.text:
Which of the following are causes of the Poverty in India?
  1. Efficient Resource utilisation
  2. Unemployment
  3. Low rate of Economic Development 
  4. Population Explosion
Choose the correct option using the code given below:
options: 2, 3 and 4 only
1 and 2 only
3 and 4 only
4 only
All of the above

quiz.text: Usual status (US) unemployment is calculated with reference to a period of:
options: Yearly
Monthly
Biannually
Weekly
Quarterly

quiz.text: Who of the following presented the Peoples Plan?
options: M N Roy
Jawaharlal Nehru
Mahatma Gandhi
Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel
None of the above

quiz.text: Unemployment which is associated with the inadequacy of productive capacity to create enough jobs for all those able and willing to work refers to
options: Frictional unemployment
Cyclical unemployment
Structural unemployment
Open unemployment
Disguised Unemployment

quiz.text: If a person is ready to work at the prevailing wage rate in the market, but he is unable to find the work, then what type of unemployment would it be called?
options: Voluntary Unemployment
Involuntary Unemployment
Seasonal Unemployment
Disguised Unemployment
Cyclical Unemployment

quiz.text: Which type of unemployment has the marginal productivity of the workers as zero?
options: Disguised Unemployment
Involuntary unemployment
Seasonal unemployment
Structural Unemployment
None of the above

quiz.text: The "head count ratio" is related to which one of the following?
options: The poverty line
Millennium Development Goals
Food insecurity
Population Growth
None of the above

quiz.text: Consider the following statements about poverty:1. Poverty can be termed as a ‘cognitive tax’ on the poor2. Poverty brings in wide-ranging behavioral changes in a person3. Poverty keeps the vicious cycle perpetuating foreverChoose the correct statements using the codes given below
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
3 only
2 Only
All of the above

quiz.text: Who coined the term disguised unemployment?
options: John Keynes
Amartya Sen
Joan Robinson
Alfred Marshall
None of the above

quiz.text: What is the right formula to know the unemployment rate?
options: Total number of unemployed / total labour force X 100
Total labour force / Total number of unemployed x 100
Total number of unemployed / total labour force x 1000
Total labour force / Total number of unemployed x 1000
None of the above

quiz.text: Select the correct statement about the term ‘unemployment trap’
options: A situation in the economy when the rate of employment growth is less than the rate of increase in the unemployed population
A situation when unemployed population of an economy does not feel encouraged to become employed
A situation of frictional unemployment when there is a heavy rush of labour force from the primary to the secondary activities
A situation when existing job loss is higher than the new jobs created
None of the above

quiz.text: It occurs when a worker is shifting from one job to the other. During the mobility period, he may unemployed for some time. It is a temporary phenomenon. In other words, It is the time period between jobs when a worker is searching for, or transitioning from one job to another. It is sometimes called search engine and can be voluntary based on the circumstances of the unemployed individual.  Which of the following type of unemployment is discussed in the passage?
options: Cyclical Unemployment
Frictional Unemployment
Disguised Unemployment
Seasonal Unemployment
Casual Unemployment
